results.title: Different Types of Statins and All-Cause Mortality during Anticoagulation for Venous Thromboembolism: Validation Study from RIETE Registry
results.text_hl: Time zero was the date of @<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@VTE@@@ and censoring occurred at the time of last follow-up.

citations.NLM: Siniscalchi C, Suriñach JM, Visonà A, Fernández-Reyes JL, Gómez-Cuervo C, Verhamme P, Marchena PJ, Farge-Bancel D, Moisés J, Monreal M, and the RIETE Investigators. Different Types of Statins and All-Cause Mortality during Anticoagulation for Venous Thromboembolism: Validation Study from RIETE Registry TH Open. 2020 Jul;4(3):e236-e244. PMID: 32964178

results.title: Adherence to statins is associated with reduced incidence of idiopathic venous thromboembolism: real-life data from a large healthcare maintenance organisation.
results.text_hl: The @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ dose, the most frequently prescribed statin, was negatively associated with the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@VTE@@@.

citations.NLM: Rabinowich L, Steinvil A, Leshem-Rubinow E, Berliner S, Zeltser D, Rogowski O, Shalev V, Raz R, Chodick G. Adherence to statins is associated with reduced incidence of idiopathic venous thromboembolism: real-life data from a large healthcare maintenance organisation. Heart. 2012 Dec;98(24):1817-21. PMID: 23038788
